intro: Coulterina newberryi, commonly known as Newberry's coulterina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly in California and Oregon, where it grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in late spring to early summer. Coulterina newberryi is often found in open woodlands and chaparral, thriving in well-drained soils.
